Project Name: Urgent restoration to existing road formation of NH66 between Km. 572/500 to Km.595/200 in the state of Goa.
Project Description: The stretch of existing NH66 between km.578/000 to km.582/500 passes through Karmal Ghat area, the geometrics of which are not as per NH standards. There are many sharp/blind horizontal curves wherein there are no proper sight distances/visibility ahead. Further there are no adequate side shoulders to this intermediate lane stretch and in some places the carpet edges are exposed.;;Over the past many years, no permanent measures have been taken to improve the said accident-prone stretch of National Highway. The land required for improvement is forest land and hence Forest Conservation Act 1980 is applicable to the said area. The approx. forest land required for the project is 0.03 Ha in Survey no103(P) in village of Canacona taluka,Goa. Since there is no other option involved other than proposed improvement in forest land, the State PWD in consultation with State Forest Department has initiated required process for diversion of forest land (0.03 Ha) for non-forestry purpose under FCA.

Project Name: Augmentation of Khandepar river by pumping of water from abandoned mining pit at Kirlapal Dabal and its Conjunctive use for Agricultural purpose.
Project Description: Since the abandoned mining pit falls within a forest area and lacks proper public road access, diverting 0.4810 hectares of forest land for non-forestry purposes is necessary. The State Water Resources Department (WRD), in consultation with the State Forest Department, has initiated the required process for forest land diversion under the Forest Conservation Act.;;This project aims to provide a sustainable solution to the water scarcity faced by cultivators in Dharbandora Taluka. By pumping water from the abandoned mining pit and delivering it to the agricultural fields, the project will ensure crop irrigation during the dry season, improve agricultural productivity, and support the livelihoods of local farmers. While forest land diversion is required, the project has been carefully designed to minimize environmental impact and comply with all necessary regulations.;
